definitions.text: the concentration of attention or energy on something
examples: the focus of activity shifted to molecular biology
he had no direction in his life

definitions.text: maximum clarity or distinctness of an image rendered by an optical system
maximum clarity or distinctness of an idea
examples: the controversy brought clearly into focus an important difference of opinion

definitions.text: a central point or locus of an infection in an organism

examples: the stress was more on accuracy than on speed

definitions.text: a point of convergence of light (or other radiation) or a point from which it diverges
a fixed reference point on the concave side of a conic section

examples: Please focus on your studies and not on your hobbies

definitions.text: cause to converge on or toward a central point
examples: Focus the light on this image

definitions.text: bring into focus or alignment; to converge or cause to converge; of ideas or emotions
become focussed or come into focus

examples: Please focus the image; we cannot enjoy the movie
